module_restrictions: Students must meet prerequisites of courses
visa_info: Students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university
accommodations_info: All on-campus housing (except the Sustainable Village) requires the purchase of a meal plan.
cost_of_living: Students should be prepared to pay approximately USD $2,500 in mandatory fees each semester.
university_description: The University of Alaska Fairbanks (UAF) is a public research university in Fairbanks, Alaska.
university_address: 505 South Chandalar Drive, Fairbanks, Alaska, USA
location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Fairbanks, Alaska is generally higher than the national average due to the remote location of the city and harsh winters.
location_weather: Fairbanks has a subarctic climate with long, cold winters and short, warm summers.
location_description: Fairbanks is a small city located in the interior of Alaska, known for its outdoor recreational opportunities and proximity to the Arctic Circle.
location_crime: Fairbanks has a relatively high crime rate compared to other cities in Alaska.
location_transportation: Fairbanks has limited public transportation options, and most people rely on personal vehicles or walking/biking to get around.
location_halal: Halal food options in Fairbanks are limited.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are available in Fairbanks, but may be limited compared to larger cities.
